verses.verse: And a letter came to him from Elijah the prophet, saying, Thus says the LORD God of your father David: Because you have not walked in the ways of Jehoshaphat your father, or in the ways of Asa king of Judah,

but have walked in the way of the kings of Israel, and have (2 Chr. 21:11) made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to ((Ex. 34:15); Deut. 31:16) play the harlot like the (1 Kin. 16:31-33; 2 Kin. 9:22) harlotry of the house of Ahab, and also have (1 Kin. 2:32; 2 Chr. 21:4) killed your brothers, those of your father’s household, who were better than yourself,
behold, the LORD will strike your people with a serious affliction—your children, your wives, and all your possessions;
and you will become very sick with a (2 Chr. 21:18, 19) disease of your intestines, until your intestines come out by reason of the sickness, day by day.
Moreover the (2 Chr. 33:11; (Jer. 51:11)) LORD (1 Kin. 11:14, 23) stirred up against Jehoram the spirit of the Philistines and the (2 Chr. 17:11) Arabians who were near the Ethiopians.

And they came up into Judah and invaded it, and carried away all the possessions that were found in the king’s house, and also (2 Chr. 24:7) his sons and his wives, so that there was not a son left to him except Jehoahaz, the youngest of his sons.
After all this the LORD struck him (2 Chr. 13:20; 21:15; Acts 12:23) in his intestines with an incurable disease.

Then it happened in the course of time, after the end of two years, that his intestines came out because of his sickness; so he died in severe pain. And his people made no burning for him, like (2 Chr. 16:14) the burning for his fathers.

He was thirty-two years old when he became king. He reigned in Jerusalem eight years and, to no one’s sorrow, departed. However they buried him in the City of David, but not in the tombs of the kings.

Ahaziah Reigns in Judah Then the inhabitants of Jerusalem made (2 Chr. 21:17; 22:6) Ahaziah his youngest son king in his place, for the raiders who came with the (2 Chr. 21:16) Arabians into the camp had killed all the (2 Chr. 21:17) older sons. So Ahaziah the son of Jehoram, king of Judah, reigned.
Ahaziah was forty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned one year in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was (2 Chr. 21:6) Athaliah the granddaughter of Omri.
He also walked in the ways of the house of Ahab, for his mother advised him to do wickedly.
